content.webTitle: Pick of the day: New Kids On the Blog

fields.headline: Pick of the day
fields.bodyText: Matt Frei's documentary is officially entitled New Kids On the Blog (11am, Radio 4), but I like to think of it as The Wonderful Wizards of Blogs. This wide-eyed skip across America resembles nothing so much as Dorothy's journey along the Yellow Brick Road, as Frei meets a string of unlikely characters in a bewildering world. "We're off," he declares, "to see the media revolution at work!" Or, if you prefer, "to spend some quality time with the sans- culottes who are smashing the icons". Will and Rob are two youngish New Yorkers who produce an online video briefing called Political Lunch; "Pundit Mom" blogs about weighty issues from her kitchen on the outskirts of Washington DC. Will and Rob's largest-ever audience was 10,000 viewers, but Frei is both delighted and terrified at the threat they and their peers pose to traditional, resource-intensive media. "Somewhere," as the old-school broadcaster Dan Rather puts it, "there need to be professional journalists who spend their time trying to separate brass tacks from bullfeathers." You can almost hear Frei nodding along.
